verses.kjv: At that time Jesus went on the sabbath day through the corn; and his disciples were an hungred, and began to pluck the ears of corn, and to eat.
verses.ct: Around that time, Jesus was walking through the grain fields on the Sabbath. His disciples were hungry, so they started picking heads of grain and eating them.

verses.kjv: But when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto him, Behold, thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the sabbath day.
verses.ct: When the Pharisees noticed this, they said to him, "Look, your disciples are doing something that's not permitted on the Sabbath!"

verses.kjv: But he said unto them, Have ye not read what David did, when he was an hungred, and they that were with him;
verses.ct: He replied, "Haven't you read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?

verses.kjv: How he entered into the house of God, and did eat the shewbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for them which were with him, but only for the priests?
verses.ct: He went into the house of God and ate the sacred bread, which neither he nor his companions were allowed to eat — only the priests could eat it.

verses.kjv: Or have ye not read in the law, how that on the sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the sabbath, and are blameless?
verses.ct: Or haven't you read in the Law that on the Sabbath the priests work in the temple and technically violate the Sabbath, yet they're considered innocent?

verses.kjv: But I say unto you, That in this place is one greater than the temple.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, something greater than the temple is right here.

verses.kjv: But if ye had known what this meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless.
verses.ct: If you had understood what this means — 'I desire mercy, not sacrifice' — you wouldn't have condemned people who have done nothing wrong.

verses.kjv: For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day.
verses.ct: Because the Son of Man is Lord over the Sabbath itself."

verses.kjv: And when he was departed thence, he went into their synagogue:
verses.ct: After leaving that place, he went into their synagogue.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there was a man which had his hand withered. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath days? that they might accuse him.
verses.ct: A man with a deformed hand was there. Looking for a reason to bring charges against Jesus, they asked him, "Is it permitted to heal someone on the Sabbath?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What man shall there be among you, that shall have one sheep, and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day, will he not lay hold on it, and lift it out?
verses.ct: He answered them, "If any of you owned a single sheep and it fell into a ditch on the Sabbath, wouldn't you grab it and pull it out?

verses.kjv: How much then is a man better than a sheep? Wherefore it is lawful to do well on the sabbath days.
verses.ct: A person is worth so much more than a sheep! So yes, it is permitted to do good on the Sabbath."

verses.kjv: Then saith he to the man, Stretch forth thine hand. And he stretched it forth; and it was restored whole, like as the other.
verses.ct: Then he told the man, "Hold out your hand." The man held it out, and it was completely restored, just as healthy as the other one.

verses.kjv: Then the Pharisees went out, and held a council against him, how they might destroy him.
verses.ct: The Pharisees left and began plotting together how they could kill him.

verses.kjv: But when Jesus knew it, he withdrew himself from thence: and great multitudes followed him, and he healed them all;
verses.ct: When Jesus learned about this, he left that area. Large crowds followed him, and he healed every one of them.

verses.kjv: And charged them that they should not make him known:
verses.ct: But he warned them not to spread the word about who he was.

verses.kjv: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: This fulfilled what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:

verses.kjv: Behold my servant, whom I have chosen; my beloved, in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my spirit upon him, and he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles.
verses.ct: "Here is my servant, the one I have chosen, my beloved, in whom my soul is deeply pleased. I will place my spirit on him, and he will proclaim justice to the nations.

verses.kjv: He shall not strive, nor cry; neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets.
verses.ct: He will not argue or shout, and no one will hear his voice raised in the streets.

verses.kjv: A bruised reed shall he not break, and smoking flax shall he not quench, till he send forth judgment unto victory.
verses.ct: He will not snap a damaged reed or snuff out a smoldering wick, until he brings justice to victory.

verses.kjv: And in his name shall the Gentiles trust.
verses.ct: And the nations will put their trust in his name."

verses.kjv: Then was brought unto him one possessed with a devil, blind, and dumb: and he healed him, insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake and saw.
verses.ct: Then people brought him a man who was demon-possessed, blind, and unable to speak. Jesus healed him so that the man could both talk and see.

verses.kjv: And all the people were amazed, and said, Is not this the son of David?
verses.ct: The entire crowd was astonished and asked, "Could this really be the Son of David?"

verses.kjv: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This fellow doth not cast out devils, but by Beelzebub the prince of the devils.
verses.ct: But when the Pharisees heard this, they said, "This man only drives out demons by the power of Beelzebub, the ruler of demons."

verses.kjv: And Jesus knew their thoughts, and said unto them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand:
verses.ct: Jesus knew what they were thinking and said to them, "Any kingdom torn apart by internal conflict will collapse. Any city or household divided against itself will fall apart.

verses.kjv: And if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself; how shall then his kingdom stand?
verses.ct: If Satan is driving out Satan, then he's fighting against himself. How could his kingdom survive?

verses.kjv: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your children cast them out? therefore they shall be your judges.
verses.ct: And if I'm driving out demons by Beelzebub's power, then by whose power do your own followers drive them out? They themselves will prove you wrong.

verses.kjv: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God is come unto you.
verses.ct: But if I'm driving out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has arrived right in front of you.

verses.kjv: Or else how can one enter into a strong man’s house, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man? and then he will spoil his house.
verses.ct: How can anyone break into a powerful man's house and steal his possessions unless he first ties up the powerful man? Only then can he ransack the house.

verses.kjv: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.
verses.ct: Whoever isn't on my side is against me, and whoever doesn't gather with me is scattering.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I say unto you, All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men: but the blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men.
verses.ct: That is why I'm telling you: every kind of sin and blasphemy will be forgiven, but blasphemy against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

verses.kjv: And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, neither in the world to come.
verses.ct: Whoever speaks against the Son of Man can be forgiven, but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven — not in this age and not in the age to come.

verses.kjv: Either make the tree good, and his fruit good; or else make the tree corrupt, and his fruit corrupt: for the tree is known by his fruit.
verses.ct: Either consider the tree good and its fruit good, or consider the tree rotten and its fruit rotten — because a tree is identified by its fruit.

verses.kjv: O generation of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? for out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.
verses.ct: You nest of snakes! How can you say anything good when you yourselves are evil? The mouth speaks from whatever fills the heart.

verses.kjv: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.
verses.ct: A good person produces good things from the good stored up inside, and an evil person produces evil things from the evil stored up inside.

verses.kjv: But I say unto you, That every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.
verses.ct: I'm telling you that on judgment day, people will have to answer for every careless word they've spoken.

verses.kjv: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.
verses.ct: Your own words will either prove you innocent or prove you guilty."

verses.kjv: Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered, saying, Master, we would see a sign from thee.
verses.ct: Then some of the religious scholars and Pharisees responded, "Teacher, we want to see you perform a miraculous sign."

verses.kjv: But he answered and said unto them, An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas:
verses.ct: He answered them, "A wicked and unfaithful generation demands a sign, but the only sign it will receive is the sign of the prophet Jonah.

verses.kjv: For as Jonas was three days and three nights in the whale’s belly; so shall the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
verses.ct: Just as Jonah spent 3 days and 3 nights in the belly of the great fish, the Son of Man will spend 3 days and 3 nights in the depths of the earth.

verses.kjv: The men of Nineveh shall rise in judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: because they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.
verses.ct: The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment alongside this generation and condemn it, because they turned from their sins when Jonah preached to them — and someone greater than Jonah is here now.

verses.kjv: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
verses.ct: The Queen of the South will stand up at the judgment alongside this generation and condemn it, because she traveled from the farthest corners of the earth to hear Solomon's wisdom — and someone greater than Solomon is here now.

verses.kjv: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.
verses.ct: When an evil spirit leaves a person, it wanders through barren places searching for rest but doesn't find any.

verses.kjv: Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished.
verses.ct: Then it says, 'I'll go back to the home I left.' When it returns, it finds the place empty, cleaned up, and neatly arranged.

verses.kjv: Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last state of that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation.
verses.ct: So it goes and brings along 7 other spirits even more wicked than itself, and they all move in and settle there. That person ends up worse off than before. This is exactly what will happen to this wicked generation."

verses.kjv: While he yet talked to the people, behold, his mother and his brethren stood without, desiring to speak with him.
verses.ct: While Jesus was still speaking to the crowd, his mother and brothers were standing outside, wanting to talk with him.

verses.kjv: Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to speak with thee.
verses.ct: Someone told him, "Your mother and your brothers are standing outside and want to speak with you."

verses.kjv: But he answered and said unto him that told him, Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?
verses.ct: He replied to the person who told him, "Who is my mother? And who are my brothers?"

verses.kjv: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!
verses.ct: Then he gestured toward his disciples and said, "Look — here are my mother and my brothers!

verses.kjv: For whosoever shall do the will of my Father which is in heaven, the same is my brother, and sister, and mother.
verses.ct: Anyone who does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother, my sister, and my mother."
